intro: Lasianthera malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca lasianthera, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
